titleStmt.title: Taʾammǝra ʿUrāʾel ‘Miracles of Uriel’ / Taʾammǝra ʾIyasus ‘Miracles of Jesus’ / Taʾammǝra Zamikāʾel ʾAragāwi ‘Miracles of Zamikāʾel ʾAragāwi’ / Taʾammǝra Māryām ‘Miracles of Mary’

list.note: are of more recent time. , quires from to and form the oldest layer of the manuscript. , and quires from to were added to the manuscript some time later. originates from a different, older codex.

supportDesc.condition: The back board is broken and crudely repaired. The leather cover is perforated. The manuscript was resewn.

item.desc: The title ተአምረ፡ ማርያም is written on the front board with black modern paint.
The internal number of the monastic library (508) is written on the inner side of the front cover.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards (the back board is broken and crudely repaired).
Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover.

history.origin:
According to Additio 2, was donated in the time of King (r. 1508–1540). The manuscript consists of 5 production units: consisting of , quires from to and is the oldest and can be dated to the first half of the 16th cent.
consisting of and quires from to date to the beginning of the 17th cent.
containing and containing date to a more recent time, most likely the 19th cent.
with a single (containing a miniature) originates from an old codex (most likely 15th cent).

provenance.p: According to Additio 2 of , Gabra Manfas Qǝddus donated the manuscript to ; he is also mentioned on (, Hand 4, 16th cent).
ʾAbuna Bǝʾse ʾƎgziʾabǝḥer is mentioned as the commissioner of : in the concluding supplication formula of ; furthermore, his name is written throughout and (Hand 5, beginning of the 17th century).
ʾAbuna Gabra Māryām is mentioned in supplication formulas throughout (Hand 1, 19th century) of
The names Gabra Śǝllāse and Gabra ʾAmlāk are written in ( of , (Hand 2, 19th century).

msItem.incipit: ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ኡራኤል፡ ሊቀ፡ መላእክት፡። ወአመ፡ ተሰቅለ፡ እግዚእነ፡ ወአምላክነ፡ አመ፡ ፳ወ፯ቱ፡ለመጋቢት፡ በቀራንዮ፡ በዕለተ፡ ዓርብ፡ ጊዜ፡ ፱ሰዓት፡ ቀድሐ፡ ደመ፡ እግዚእነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡

msItem.note: There are two miracles. A passage of the first miracle,, is missing at the beginning. The second miracle has only a few beginning lines.
It contains only a small fragment from the early part of the text, though not from the very beginning.
Only a fragment of a miracle story from the beginning is preserved.

handDesc.handNote: () Nineteenth-century script. Black, red (vivid red). Fine, regular, with rounded letters. Divine names; name of the donor; a few lines of the incipit; elements of Ethiopic numerals; elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers.

(, ) Nineteenth-century script. Black, red (strong vermillion red). Mediocre, right-sloping letters with notable hairlines. Gabra Madḫǝn is mentioned as the scribe of on Divine names; incipits; elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers.

provenance.p: The names Gabra Śǝllāse and Gabra ʾAmlāk are written in on by Hand 2.

msItem.note: It is unclear whether the text is complete. It is hard to say without a detailed study whether the are missing miracles between and . There is a continuation between the text on and .

msItem.incipit: ጸሎተ፡ ዘይትበሃል፡ እምቅድመ፡ ያንብቡ፡ ተኣምሪሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡

msItem.title: Excerpt from the Gospel of John (Jn. 19:25‒27)

msItem.note: There are 113 miracles, all of them are numbered.
msItem.incipit: ኦእግዝእትየ፡ ማርያም፡ እምቤተ፡ መንግሥት፡ ወእምቤተ፡ ክህነት፡ ተወለድኪ፡

handDesc.handNote:
() and () Sixteenth-century script. Fine, occasionally irregular (e.g., ) script with slender, tall and broadly spaced letters, with distinctive features: some letters have the hook vowel marker at the top, not in the middle: e.g., ው, ዮ, ድ, ጽ; the hook vowel marker of ጵ is attached to the left side of the vertical stroke; the letters ፅ and ዕ are usually cone-shaped, downward oriented; archaic forms of numbers ፪, ፬, and ፮.
In
ይበል፡ ዲ፡ for ይበል፡ ዲያቆን፡ ()
Divine names; groups of lines on the opening page of and , incipit of all other texts, incipit of sections of most of the texts and section numbers of ; the word salām ‘salutation’ in ; directives for the ministers in ; elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers; Ethiopic numerals (, ).

decoNote.desc: (opening page of ) Elaborate coloured (vivid red) ornamental band with one central and two lateral pendants reaching the middle of the page; interlaces and floral motifs.
(opening page of ) Elaborate coloured (vivid red) ornamental band with one central and two lateral pendants reaching the middle of the page; interlaces and geometric motifs.

item.desc: (upper margin): . It is probably written in Hand 5.
item.q: ሰላም፡ ለኪ፡ ኆኅተ፡ ምሥራቅ፡ ዘወልደ፡ ኖሬ፡ ሰላም፡ ለኪ፡ ዓፀድ፡ ዘኤሰኬድሬ፡

item.desc: The note mentions Gabra Manfas Qǝddus, son of Gabra Krǝstos and of ʾAśrāta Māryām, as the donor of the book for . The donation took place during the reign of Lǝbna Dǝngǝl, when the following people were in office: nǝbura ʾǝd ʾAbbā Sāmuʾel, qas gabaz ʾAbbā Gabra Krǝstos, raqmaʾāsarā ʾAbbā Habta ʾIyasus, qǝntān ʾAbbā Ṗāwlos, and mamhǝr ʾAbuna Tarbinos. The note is hastily written probably in Hand 4.
item.q:
በአኰቴተ፡ አብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ወሀብኩ፡ አነ፡ ገብረ፡ መንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ወልዶሙ፡ ለገብረ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ወለዓሥራተ፡ ማርያም፡ መጽሐፈ፡ ተአምሪሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ለመካነ፡ አቡነ፡ አረጋዊ፡ ከመ፡ ይኩነኒ፡ ረዳኤ፡ በዕለተ፡ ደይን፡ እንዘ፡ ንጉሥነ፡ ልብነ፡ ድንግል። ወንቡረ፡ እድ፡
በዳሞ፡ አባ፡ ሳሙኤል። ወቀስ፡ ገበዝ፡ አባ፡ ገብረ፡ ክርስቶስ። ወረቅመአሰራ፡ አባ፡ ሀብተ፡ ኢየሱስ። ወቅንታን፡ አባ፡ ጳውሎስ። ወእንዘ፡ መምህርነ፡ አቡነ፡ ተርቢኖስ፡ ከመ፡ ኢያውፅእዋ፡ እምቤተ፡ ምንባራ፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ለርኢይ፡ በውስቴታ። ውጉዘ፡ ይኩን፡ በአፈ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወበአፈ፡ አቡነ፡ አረጋዊ። ወአቡነ፡ አ፩[sic]፡ አምላክ። ወበአፈ፡ ፲ወ፭፡ ነቢያት። ወ፲ወ፪፡ ሐዋርያት። ወበአፈ፡ ፫፻፲ወ፰፡ ርቱዓ፡ ሃይማ
ኖት፡ ወበአፈ፡ አብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን።
item.foreign: In praise of the Father and the Son, and the Holy Spirit, I, Gabra Manfas Qǝddus, son of Gabra Krǝstos and ʾAśrāta Māryām, have donated the book ‘The Miracles of Our Lady Mary’ to the place of ʾAbuna ʾAragāwi, so that it might be for me an assistance on the Day of Judgement. This was in the time of our king, Lǝbna Dǝngǝl, and nǝbura ʾǝd ʾAbbā Sāmuʾel and qas gabaz ʾAbbā Gabra Krǝstos, and raqamaʾāsarā ʾAbbā Habta ʾIyasus, and qǝntān ʾAbbā Ṗāwlos, and while our mamhǝr was ʾAbuna Tarbinos. This book shall not be taken out of the house, but is only to be seen within it. (Whoever takes it out) shall be excommunicated by the mouth of Our Lady Mary, and by the mouth of ʾAbuna ʾAragāwi, and by the mouth of ʾAbuna ʾAḥadu ʾAmlāk; by the mouth of the fifteen Prophets and the twelve Apostles; by the mouth of the 318 Orthodox Fathers of Nicaea; and by the mouth of the Father, and the Son, and the Holy Spirit. Forever and ever. Amen.

item.desc: Condemnation for those who steal the book. The unfinished note is written in a mediocre hand, probably in recent time.
(several lines) Erasures are marked with parallel lines.
An omitted passage is written in the upper margin in a secondary fine hand.

list.item: in Hand 5 in a secondary hand Corrections are written over erased words and passages.

origin.origDate: According to Additio 2, the main production unit was donated in the time of King Lǝbna Dǝngǝl (r. 1508‒40).

provenance.p: According to Additio 2, Gabra Manfas Qǝddus donated the manuscript to ; he is also mentioned on (, Hand 4).

msItem.title: ʾO-ʾǝgzǝʾtǝya qǝddǝst dǝngǝl ba-kǝlʾe Māryām walādita ʾamlāk ʻO my Lady, Holy Two-fold Virgin Mary, Godbearing ...ʼ
ʾO-ʾǝgzǝʾtǝya qǝddǝst dǝngǝl Māryām Mārihām ʾǝmmu la-ʾIyasus Krǝstos kahāli ʻO my Lady, Holy Virgin Mary, Mother of Jesus Christ the Almighty...ʼ
salām laki ʾo-ʾǝgzǝʾtǝya qǝddǝst dǝngǝl Māryām ʾǝmma madḫǝn wa-ʾǝmma bǝrhān ʻSalutation to you, o my Lady, Holy Virgin Mary, Mother of the Saviour and Mother of the Light ...ʼ
ʾƎsaggǝd laki wa-ʾǝweddǝsaki ʻI worship Thee ...ʼ
Taʾammǝra Māryām ʻMiracles of Maryʼ
msItem.note: There are 16 miracles, all of them are numbered.

handDesc.handNote:
from to , , Seventeenth-century script. Black, red (vivid red). Neat and regular. The handwriting is characterized by finely shaped, slender and slightly right-sloping letters. Contrary to hand d, the letter መ in all vowel orders is written with the loops separated. The letters ፈ and ረ in all vowel orders and ሥ are formed with a long, diagonal stroke. The vowel marker of ስ is notably long.
ʾƎśśeta Māryām is mentioned as the scribe of on .
Divine names; names of the donors; groups of lines on the opening page of , incipit of other texts, incipit of sections of most of the texts ; the word salām the word salām ‘salutation’ in ; elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals

list.item: , Corrections are written over erased words and passages.

provenance.p: ʾAbuna Bǝʾse ʾƎgziʾabǝḥer is mentioned as the commissioner in the concluding supplication formula of ; furthermore, his name is written throughout and (Hand 5, beginning of the 17th century). Bǝʾse ʾƎgziʾabǝḥer is mentioned in a commemorative note in , which was written in 1651. The note is written as an addition, most likely by one of the main hands, not long after the manuscript was produced.

msItem.title: Unidentified text containing brief ʾarke-hymns addressing different saints and a concluding prayer.
msItem.incipit: ሰላም፡ ለማርያም፡ ለማርታ፡ ወለሰሎሜ፡ እለተለዋሁ፡ ለኢየሱስ፡ እሚሮን፡ ከመ፡ ውእቱ፡ ወልደ፡ ንጉሥ፡፡ ወትንብልናክሙ፡ ወአስተብቊዖትኩሙ፡ በጸሎትኩሙ፡ ወበስእለትክሙ፡ ወሰላምክሙ፡ የሃሉ፡ ምስሌየ፡ ወምስለ፡ ኵሎሙ፡ ውሉድ፡ መንግሥት፡
msItem.note: The beginning of the text is missing.

handNote.seg: The word salām ʻsalutationʼ and the name ʾElyās, elements of the punctuation signs.

decoNote.desc: A miniature of with a legend: ሥዕለ፡ ማርያም፡ ወወልዳ፡ ‘Image of Mary and her Son’; above on the same minature two archangels and with legends: ሥዕለ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ‘Image of Michael’ and ሥዕለ፡ ገብርኤል፡ ‘Image of Gabriel’ respectively. The leaf originates from a different older (15th cent.?) codex.

item.desc: An ownership note indicating that the book belonged to a certain ʾAbuna Taṭamqa Madḫǝn, son of ʾAbbā Sāmuʾel.
